entries.title: The Bravery and the Recklessness of Ukraine's Improvised Army
entries.description: Helping repel the Russian invasion are army units with limited military experience. The question for their country is whether they can stay alive long enough to succeed.

entries.title: Netanyahu Sworn In for Sixth Term as Israeli Prime Minister
entries.description: Benjamin Netanyahu was propelled back to the premiership by a coalition of ultranationalist and religious parties that will wield unprecedented power.

entries.title: Middlemen Snag Carbon-Credit Cash Aimed at Peruvian Amazon
entries.description: Only a small amount of money designated for rainforest preservation reaches the people who live there.

entries.title: Russian Politician and Businessman Dies After Falling From Hotel Roof
entries.description: The demise of a lawmaker who owned a sausage-making company follows the deaths of several other high-profile Russians in violent or mysterious circumstances in recent months.

entries.title: Russia Launches Fresh Missile Barrage at Targets Across Ukraine
entries.description: Ukraine’s armed forces said 69 missiles were fired by Russia, and 54 of them were downed by Ukrainian air defenses.

entries.title: South Korea Takes Hard Look at Strategy After North's Drone Flights
entries.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol berated his defense minister over the military’s failed response to the airspace invasions by Pyongyang.

entries.title: Europe Taps Tech's Power-Hungry Data Centers to Heat Homes
entries.description: With an energy crisis hitting Europe, governments are exploring ways to recycle electricity used on social-media scrolling, conference calls and video streaming to help heat homes and offices.
